title: Out of Memory Error when running 'geth account new' on Raspberry Pi
body:

Hmm. It's been a long while since I played with running on an RPI v1, but its memory is very very limited (256 MB) and we haven't run many tests to try and fit into that. Any particular reason why you would want to run a full geth node on an RPI v1?

@Famicoman This is a feature actually, it comes from using scrypt with parameters set rather high, it consumes an additional 256MB during account generation.

You can try adding a swap file manually to get around this:

``` bash
dd if=/dev/zero of=/PATH/FILENAME bs=1024 count=SIZE
mkswap /PATH/FILENAME
swapon /PATH/FILENAME
```

@karalabe I was an early adopter. I have a single 256 MB model RPi, two 512 MB revisions, and a single Raspberry Pi 2. As these devices age, they slowly lose support so I start to wonder what I can do with them. I may just up to the 512 MB version for ethereum.

@Gustav-Simonsson I generated a 512 MB swap file and while it took a while, I got an account to generate. Thanks very much! I was hesitant of setting up a swap because of the toll it can take on an SD card, but that's nothing a swapoff can't fix after generation.
